result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10;04  AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court w/Jacob Ryan Clemenson. INCLUDES: 22CF593 (PH), 2021CF732, 2021CF865, 2022CF12, 2022CF42, 2022CF104, and 2022CF239 (all STC). Further cross by Atty Erdman. Attys argue bond over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Erdman notes that there is likely a resolution on all matters. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned: 10:19 am.

AMENDED

INCLUDES 21CF593, 21CF732, 21CF865 and 22CF12

$500 in file

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

- Defendant to meet with Probation Agent as scheduled.

- Defendant to test with Probation Agent at every meeting. Probation to inform the court of any POSITIVE results. A positive result with the agent is subject to bail jumping.

- Defendant to report to Justice Support Center today after court for testing.
